items.sentence: Tom told you about what we did, didn\'t he?
Tom visits Mary every time he\'s in Boston.
I can\'t remember exactly who told me that.
I can\'t remember the last time I did this.
I can\'t remember what happened after that.
I can\'t remember when Tom moved to Boston.
I don\'t think Tom knows that you\'re here.
It\'s been ten years since I came to Japan.
Thank you for helping me to do my homework.
I wouldn\'t have done that any differently.
I wouldn\'t want you to think I was stupid.
I\'d like Tom to handle this investigation.
I\'d like to become a famous soccer player.
Tom would\'ve helped us if we\'d asked him.
I can\'t ask you to put yourself in danger.
She advised him to see a lawyer, so he did.
She believed him when he said he loved her.
She came close to falling off the platform.
She confronted him and demanded an apology.
How many cups of coffee do you drink a day?
How many hot dogs did you eat last weekend?
How many hours a day does Tom study French?
How many people do you have in your family?
How many times did Tom tell you to do that?
How much did you charge Tom to fix his car?
Do you know the reason why she is so angry?
Can you tell me what you\'re talking about?
Tom could\'ve and should\'ve stayed longer.
I think you need to think about the future.
I think you should reexamine the situation.
I thought Tom had a meeting this afternoon.
Aren\'t you going to be home for Christmas?
Aren\'t you going to do something about it?
Aren\'t you going to eat that piece of pie?
Aren\'t you going to go out with Tom again?
Aren\'t you going to see Tom again tonight?
Aren\'t you going to tell me what happened?
Can I get a lift back to the city with you?
Can you help me translate that into French?
Can you squeeze me into your busy schedule?
Did you buy that painting we saw yesterday?
Did you forget to talk to Tom this morning?
Tom said you speak French better than Mary.
Tom saw Mary sitting alone on a park bench.
Tom showed Mary some pictures of his house.
I didn\'t want Tom to go to Boston with me.
I didn\'t want to make a big deal about it.
I don\'t always brush my teeth after I eat.
What I want is is a little peace and quiet.
What are you going to be doing this summer?
Tom wants to know when you\'ll be finished.
Tom wants to know when you\'re coming home.
Tom wants to know who Mary\'s boyfriend is.
I didn\'t realize that I\'d made a mistake.
Last night, we watched television together.
We need to find what\'s inside these boxes.
I don\'t go shopping as often as I used to.
I don\'t have any problem getting to sleep.
I don\'t have time to answer any questions.
I don\'t have to worry about finding a job.
Tourists from all over the world come here.
Walking to work in this heat is a bad idea.
Was Tom the one who told you where to park?
Water boils at one hundred degrees Celsius.
I want to know if I can come over and play.
I want you to get here as soon as possible.
I was wondering if you could do me a favor.
I always wondered whether you\'d come back.
I don\'t think anyone noticed what you did.
I wouldn\'t be surprised if Tom left early.
Tom found Mary\'s umbrella behind the sofa.
I still have no idea why Tom is so unhappy.
I still have some work that has to be done.
Tom and I don\'t know each other very well.
I hope this\'ll be the last time I see you.
I hope we don\'t have to wait for too long.
I just don\'t feel like doing that tonight.
I remember the way you used to look at Tom.
I should be in Boston before noon tomorrow.
I slept on the plane for a couple of hours.
Why couldn\'t someone have told me earlier?
Why did you tell Tom Mary didn\'t like him?
I would\'ve loved going to Boston with you.
I\'d like to find a job that I enjoy doing.
I thought you didn\'t want to get involved.
Tom hasn\'t been himself the last few days.
Tom hasn\'t called the fire department yet.
Tom hasn\'t cleaned his gun in a long time.
Tom keeps a spare key hidden in his garden.
Tom knows Mary would never do such a thing.
Tom learned to ride a bike when he was ten.
Tom is the only person who can do this job.
Tom is the only person who can help me now.
Tom is the person I gave my old bicycle to.
Tom confessed that he had stolen the money.
Tom did his best to help Mary learn French.
I think you should speak a bit more slowly.
I think you should take that job in Boston.
I think you worry too much about the house.
I thought we would have breakfast together.
